repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->
Forks are needed in order to create a PR to a repo where one doesn't have write access. Since most contributors (including core maintainers) keep a fork of Neovim, let's recommend this in the docs.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
- Fork the repository first.
```

1. Everyone should create a fork. Currently, even core maintainers with write access use forks instead of creating branches in the main repo - which is a good practice.
2. Almost anyone reading CONTRIBUTING.md likely doesn't have write access anyway.
3. It could raise question about what "write access" means.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,6 +55,7 @@ Developer guidelines
 Pull requests (PRs)
 ---------------------
 
+- If you don't have write access, fork the repository first.

comment_data.body: I completely agree with you, but other devs aren't onboard with the general recommendation of forks.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,6 +55,7 @@ Developer guidelines
 Pull requests (PRs)
 ---------------------
 
+- If you don't have write access, fork the repository first.

comment_data.body:
> I completely agree with you, but other devs aren't onboard with the general recommendation of forks.

I'm not against suggesting create a fork - see the "suggested change". I just don't think it's worth adding the "only if you don't have write access" caveat for the reasons mentioned above.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,6 +55,7 @@ Developer guidelines
 Pull requests (PRs)
 ---------------------
 
+- If you don't have write access, fork the repository first.

comment_data.body: It's not a "general recommendation" if you put it in the "Pull requests" section.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,6 +55,7 @@ Developer guidelines
 Pull requests (PRs)
 ---------------------
 
+- If you don't have write access, fork the repository first.

comment_data.body: It's not even really a "recommendation" since it's a required step for creating a PR. This is more of a reminder/guide for those who aren't yet familiar with the process.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,6 +55,7 @@ Developer guidelines
 Pull requests (PRs)
 ---------------------
 
+- If you don't have write access, fork the repository first.

comment_regular_data.body: This part of the docs is about how to develop Nvim locally, not about how to contribute.

> This part of the docs is about how to develop Nvim locally, not about how to contribute.

But [the contributing guidelines](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#developer-guidelines) link to these instructions.

If need be, maybe add more instructions or link to an introduction to the `Pull Requests (PRs)` section in CONTRIBUTING.md instead?. There should be no need to take a public action like create a fork (or even a github account) in advance just to start hacking and playing around.

> If need be, maybe add more instructions or link to an introduction to the `Pull Requests (PRs)` section in CONTRIBUTING.md instead?. There should be no need to take a public action like create a fork (or even a github account) in advance just to start hacking and playing around.

Fair enough. Done :)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: automation: collect in one PR and then merge automatically on a schedule
labels.name: typo

title: docs: contributors need to fork the repo first
